election_record.label: Massachusetts 1813 Lieutenant Governor

sub_unit.name: Falmouth
sub_unit.note: The votes from Falmouth were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Dalton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Dalton were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Harpswell
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Harpswell for Lieutenant Governor though there were votes for Governor.

sub_unit.name: Lundts Grant Plantation
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Lundts Grant Plantation.

sub_unit.name: Pejepscot
sub_unit.note: The votes from Pejepscot were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Raymond
sub_unit.note: The votes from Raymond were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Thompson Pond and Shakers Settlement
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Thompson Pond and Shakers Settlement.

sub_unit.name: Greenfield
sub_unit.note: In the town of Greenfield (Franklin), the votes for Governor as cast and reported were Caleb Strong 141 and Joseph B. Varnum 78. The votes for Lt. Governor as cast and reported were William Phillips 141, William B. King 78. The votes for Govenor as listed in the Official Returns were Caleb Strong 141, Joseph B. Varnum 141 and for Lt. Governor the votes in the Official Returns were William Phillips 78 and William B. King 78.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The votes from Northfield were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Warwick
sub_unit.note: The votes from Warwick were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Chesterfield
sub_unit.note: "Rec'd 12 May (too late)." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Greene Plantation.
